paragraphs.text: As selling SaaS to business, our “wet dream” has been since the beginning to be focused on the user. paragraphs.text: Congratulations on leading Tact funding round. Always good to work with someone you’ve already established a solid network alliance like Chuck Ganapathi. Tact seems to have a great team and a product that will push the convenience envelope. Enterprise Software adapted to mobile seems like a no brainer. Glad Tact moved it forward.

paragraphs.name: 6d5b
paragraphs.text: Thanks for the inspiration. Definitely employees deserve users oriented applications. There must be a way to manage security requirements releasing employees suffering. Enterprises could unblock so much employee happiness and for sure revenue associated to that!

Enterprise is still woefully behind any decent technology stack. This investment sounds very much about the people, who undoubtedly have a rolodex of buyers from their collective time at Salesforce and Oracle. That’s why it’s hard for me to get excited about 22 year-old founders of enterprise startups: they need 6 figures to hire someone with a rolodex just to get started.

b398ba2a5968.title: Enterprise is still woefully behind any decent technology stack.

paragraphs.name: bf10
paragraphs.text: The jury is out on user-centric design moving the needle in enterprise.

I personally think it’s worth designing from the user’s perspective simply because it makes a better product, but that’s despite all demands from the buyer to add features that compete with the best user experience.

97f98e5df342.name: Both Sides of the Table

paragraphs.text: For example, on voice you can either stick to a defined set of commands for asking questions and thus the users must have heavy training, or you can learn from past queries and intelligently adapt the system to look up information and deliver results. You might want to ask, “What is the Q3 sales forecast for the central region?” or “Who is the budget holder on our Dupont sales campaign?” or “Please list all of my teammates who have had communications with Verizon in the past 90 days.”
paragraphs.name: 6edd
